title: Scaling the size of text, applications and other elements 125% on a remote machine.
author: valueff
body_snippet:
Hello. Installed the application, it works, thanks. I have a question. I set the screen resolution in the application - it works.
Is it possible to increase the size of text and other elements (scale)? For example, 125%. 
To make the picture of the remote machine larger at the same resolution?
It is written in the parameters that the display parameters cannot be changed during a remote session.
Can it be somehow possible to set this scale in the mRemoteNG application, or using the registry? ...

iterations.description: The DesktopScaleFactor property in RdpProtocol.cs currently ignores the user-configured DesktopScaleFactor setting, forcing the remote session to use the local monitor's scaling (Auto) during session updates (like window resizing), which overrides any manual scaling preference (e.g., 125%).

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The DesktopScaleFactor property in RdpProtocol.cs currently ignores the user-configured DesktopScaleFactor setting, forcing the remote session to use the local monitor's scaling (Auto) during session updates (like window resizing), which overrides any manual scaling preference (e.g., 125%).
Approach: Modify the DesktopScaleFactor property in RdpProtocol.cs to respect the connectionInfo.DesktopScaleFactor setting. If set to a specific value (100, 125, 150, 200), return that value. Only fall back to the calculated local resolution scaling (ResolutionScalingFactor.Width * 100) when the setting is Auto.
